ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: created man from clots of blood.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: created man from a clot of congealed blood.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He created man from a clot of blood.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He has created man from a clot.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He created man from a clot.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: created man from a clot [of blood].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Hath created man from a clot!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: created man from a clinging mass.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Created man, out of a (mere) clot of congealed blood:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Has created man from a clot (a piece of thick coagulated blood).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: created the human from a (blood) clot.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Created man from a clinging substance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [96:2] created man (al-insān: the generic) from a blood-clot (‘alaq is the plural of ‘alaqa, which is a small quantity of congealing blood).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Createth man) i.e. the son of Adam (from a clot) and the Prophet (pbuh) said: "what shall I read?" And Gabriel read to him the first four verses of this surah.
